metadata.title: Archives of Virology Antigen Requirements and Specificity of a Mieroplate Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) for Deteetin 9 Infectious Bronchitis Viral Antibodies in Ehieken Serum

abstract.original_text: The conditions of a rapid, indirect-enzyme linked immunosorbent assay for Infectious Bronchitis Virus (IBV) antibodies have been established. Optimal sensitivity was obtained using 10 ~g/ml protein concentration of the Mass 41 strain purified from infected allantoic fluid. Specificity was demonstrated with Newcastle Disease Virus (NDV) antigen-antibody system. Negligible crossreactions were observed. After bromelain or lipase treatment IBV had an ELISA reactivity similar to untreated particles suggesting that peripheral constituents of IBV play a minor role when whole virus is adsorbed on solid phase.

sentences.segment_text: indirect-enzyme linked immunosorbent assay for Infectious Bronchitis Virus ( IBV ) antibodies have been established .
Optimal sensitivity was obtained using 10 ~ g/ml protein concentration of the Mass 41 strain purified from infected allantoic fluid .
Specificity was demonstrated with Newcastle Disease Virus ( NDV ) antigen-antibody system .

After bromelain or lipase treatment IBV had an ELISA reactivity similar to untreated particles suggesting that peripheral constituents of IBV play a minor role when whole virus is adsorbed on solid phase .

abstract.original_text: The method offers a simple and specific antibody assay which could be used for the laboratory diagnosis of avian infectious bronchitis,
